reviews.title: It's fair to say I've a fairly complex income(4 priv...
reviews.text: It's fair to say I've a fairly complex income(4 private employers and a mix of short and long contracts which end regularly.) However nowadays, this isn't totally outwith modern ways of working. In terms of risk- I had a large deposit, 17yrs of proven sustainable income from the same industry, excellent credit rating and a mortgage already in place but I was saddened to see many banks still apply such a rigid underwriting process for their mortgages. My broker was advised by some larger lenders to not even bother applying and I was offered borrowing that really was no where near in proportion to my salary. 7 weeks later, my broker suggested The Scottish Building Society. We required a lender who gave consideration to my individual circumstances, focused on the facts I'd given with my work vs asking what ifs and were able to show us flexibility ( for example I had a new contract but I'd been same job for 17yrs. My contracts may end but again, the industry is children so the nature of the work won't end.) The Scottish Building Society applied common sense with the application and demonstrated a straight forward,personalised approach to their lending. They worked efficiently , always meeting their deadlines they gave us and provided me with a better interest rate. I've also preferred their communication method through mail or phone- I've found it more refreshing than speaking to an online chat. I'd highly recommend The Scottish Building Society for their underwriting process, interest rate and communication and would always return to them in future before trying any larger bank.

reviews.text: I wanted to remortgage my house to free up money to help my son to buy a house in London. I am 72 and The Scottish Building Society was the only one to offer a loan. During the process of arranging the loan my doctor told me I probably had cancer. I then thought I would be better to sell my house and move close to my other son, about an hour away. I put a hold on the mortgage. However winter was approaching and I was advised not to market the house until next year. I then asked to have the mortgage process restarted. By this time I was very close to losing the loan due to its time limit. My broker in discussion with SBS was able to get a short extension to the time limit which enabled the mortgage to go through. The Scottish Building Society showed sympathy and understanding.

Once started, SBS were surprised to learn that we lived in England despite having had that info for months. As a result they changed the free legals to a £250 contribution to our English legals, which were £650. Once in process they insisted on a further legal form which had to be administered by a lawyer, costing a further £600. Mortgage completed 5 months after initiation at a net legal cost of £1000. Very stressful.

reviews.text: My experience with the BS was good however there were a few things I found disappointing. I was unaware that the offer made was subject to change and unfortunately your lawyers were so slow in dealing with my transfer that I have ended up paying a lot more than I expected on a monthly basis for the mortgage. The lawyers (Simpson and Marwick) also made mistakes with the costs and these also kept rising. I was rarely able to get hold of anyone to speak to about my queries as the person dealing with it seemed to be constantly “out of the office”. To add “insult to injury” they did not believe I had paid the correct amount to finalise the mortgage and I had to overpay so that the deal could be finalised without incurring more costs. However, they did recognise their mistake and reimbursed me for this. Altogether I was very unhappy the lawyers and wish in retrospect I had not used them. Your legal team were very slow and obviously working to a tight margin, pushing most of the work onto us as clients. Their process cost us 2 weeks unnecessary delay in completion costing us hundreds of pounds at SVR. My complaint to S&M received a very weak reply ie we are very busy at the moment and your case handler has been off sick. It would also be good to be able to view our balance online. reviews.title: Excellent service from Scottish Building Society
reviews.text: My move to Orkney was tricky but I couldn't have done it without Scottish Building Society. My first mortgage was agreed in principle by another lender but they declined to offer for property in Orkney! My adviser directed my request to SBS and they came up trumps with a good offer. When the sale was delayed they enabled me to extend the offer, and when it eventually fell through they gave me a second offer on another property. Admittedly this couldn't be as good an offer as the first due to the economic downturn but their quick response enabled me to stay in the limits of my finances before the worst of the increases came through.

reviews.title: Slow and antiquated with very poor service from third party providers.
reviews.text: We were very happy to be joining SBS - and still are - but it has been a painful and slow process to get here. We began a straightforward remortgage in mid August- our mortgage finally drew down in mid November and cost us over £200 in excess interest as a result. It took over six weeks to receive a mortgage offer. The broker (MAB) was only interested in securing his referral fee and progress with the application was then only made after constant chasing and direct intervention from us. Every time we called SBS direct the service was excellent. The legal service from Simpson Marwick was like something from the 1990s. A fax was even used on some occasions! The 'solicitor' was clearly following a one size fits all step by step tick box process, with no willingness to combine steps or anticipate what might be needed next. Early contact was only by post and required hand written completion of basic details forms - no digitisation at all. Since telephone contact was impossible throughout the process (just office answerphone) we were required to enter into lenghty email exchanges to resolve questions - with typically up to 24 hours between responses. Ultimately this resulted in us missing our remortgage deadline and incurring significantly higher interest costs. Overall, we are happy to be with SBS but your third party suppliers are letting you down in a major way and damaging your brand. My advice would be to bring as much of the process as possible back in house because your own people are excellent!
